column4: hi, i have trouble connecting Canon LBP 3100 printer to Ubuntu 12.04, can anyone help?
did you check the canon uk website for drivers?
Yes, i downloaded the drivers and installed it, the printer is a usb printer
when you power it up, does the system react?
not sure what you mean, but when i turn the printer on nothing happens in ubuntu
ok then in the cog menu, there is a printer app you can use there
ok
i deleted the printers i added there, and when turning the printer on it reappears in the Printing app under the cog menu
or you can use the cups web ui (old skool):  http://localhost:631
is that what you mean the system react?
Looks like it added itself in there, but when printing a test page it just states "Processing - Sending data to printer."
and nothing is printing, is there something i can check somewhere?
remove the printer, then add it manually, specifying the driver
ok, but there is only a japanese driver for my model not a uk one? can i use the japenese driver?
as long as the driver values are right, sure why not. Have you checked the openprinting database too
no, where wil i get that?
its a website
ok, i will google it
When selecting the driver it select by default this one "Canon LBP3100/LBP3108/LBP3150 CAPT (UK)" , my printer is a LBP 3100, so this one should work?
makes sense, could try the 3000 driver too
IdleOne: when printing test page, its states "Processing - Sending data to printer." is there not a problem elsewhere? its connected via usb
did you check the open printing foundation website?
is there not naybe a issue with sub port?
is there not maybe a issue with usb port?
